channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Tree Fallen partially blocking road, 2nd January
item.description:
A tree has fallen onto Sunnyfield Lane opposite the entrance to the Woodbines Mobile Homes Site. I have been able to move it such that there is now just about enough room for a car to squeeze through but a highways crew will e required to remove what is a significant hazard particularly now it is dark
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Up Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Tree causing damage/obstruction to pavement or road

item.title: 3 x Carrier Bags containg numerous cannisters of Nitrogen Sulphate Lauhing Gas dumped on grass verge betwee 26.12.2923 and 15.00 hrs 2.1.2024., 2nd January
item.description:
Dog Lane Bentham What3Words location tricycle.spoon.resonated which is midway between Bentham Church and Crickley Court constituting a health and safety risk to the public

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Dog Lane, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: Overgrown Tree, 2nd January
item.description:
Public Footpath at the rear of 43 St Michaels Road, which is considerably overhanging my property. Concerns over height and potential damage that will be caused in a Storm. I believe the Tree is approximately 40ft high and there has been no maintenance in last 5 years. Please can an inspection be carried out?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 3, Taylors End, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Pot hole outside 38 Minetts Avenue, 2nd January
item.description:
Pot hole outside my house causing my wheel the fall into it damaging my tyre every time I get off of my driveway

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27, Minetts Avenue, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Damage footpath, 2nd January
item.description:
As you enter Nine Elms road on left hand side. The house is having extensive building work done and the footpath has been left in a terrible state. Tarmac has been damaged by lorries delivering goods and it’s sunken and cracked. There is mud all over footpath which is from the site also. Please can the resident be notified and action taken immediately before someone has an accident.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nine Elms Road, Elmbridge, Gloucester
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Very large and dangerous surface damage on Bishops nDrive near junction with Tobyfield Road, 2nd January

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bishops Drive, Bishop's Cleeve

item.title: Drain blocked outside no.56, causing water to flood out into road, 2nd January
item.description:
Water flooding out of drain and onto narrow road, implying underground pipe way is blocked west of the actual outlet from the side of the road. Next drain is roughly outside no.50 so blockage expected to be underground between these two locations.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 56, Station Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road drain blocked, 2nd January
item.description:
The drain is the first travelling west from the Priory Lane entrance to station road, so location may be outside 100 rather than 102. It could not be unblocked using a 5 foot thick bamboo cane. It has been like this for a while.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 102, Station Road, Bishop's Cleeve

item.title: Abandoned car, 2nd January
item.description:
Abandoned car reg number W2 DJC - 3 series BMW, gold colour. Has been there for weeks now, partially blocking the road too. Damaged rear wheel - looks very supicious. Please action ASAP.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mill Street, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flood to this area due to poor drainage. Highways came a few months back to try to sort the issue. Left 2 “flood signs” in place. Signs now fallen over causing blocked pavements. Good now back so drain issue was never fixed. Drain cover also left raised causing a back trip hazard., 2nd January
item.description:
Martindale Road joins Farrant Avenue.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Martindale Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 2nd January
item.description:
The culvert is still blocked as of 28th December 2023. The rain has raised the height of the river Isbourne by only 50-60cms but the the Langley Brook is overflowing onto the road and then through my garden.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Wide, deep pothole which traffic needs to avoid, 2nd January
item.description:
Junction of Gotherington Lane and Station Road. Traffic driving up Station Road, past Gotherington Lane has to avoid this large hole, often hitting a cracked area around a small inspection cover in the process. Has been filled in the past, but has returned to being a large deep hole again.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gotherington Lane, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet
